intro: Thlaspi africanum, commonly known as African cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species native to Africa and parts of the Mediterranean region. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lobed or divided. Its small, white or yellow flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in spring. The seeds are small and capsule-like, dispersing easily by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution.
